q: "We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it." Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Abu Musab al-Zarqawi , a Jordanian extremist with ties to the al-Qaida terrorist network. Proponents say the two parks proposed in the legislation would stimulate tourism, create jobs and recognize a civil rights icon whose story is known worldwide. These two national parks in Maryland and Auburn, N.Y., would provide an important place where men and women of all backgrounds can come together and reflect on the significance of her life, Kirsten Gillibrand said.
